required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Basal Insulins for Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Taking Oral Diabetes Medicines and Exenatide
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Trial Comparing Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension With Insulin Glargine in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes on Oral Antihyperglycemic Medications and Exenatide

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare insulin lispro protamine suspension (ILPS) and insulin glargine in combination with the patient's oral diabetes medications and exenatide, for their ability to control blood sugar in patients with type 2 diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) at Endpoint (Last Observation Carried Forward [LOCF])
primary_outcome.description: Least squares mean values were controlled for Baseline + Baseline HbA1c Group + Baseline sulfonylurea (SU) Group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Actual Hemoglobin A1C at 24 Weeks and Endpoint (LOCF)
secondary_outcome.description: Least squares mean values were controlled for Baseline + Baseline HbA1c Group + Baseline SU Group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1C at 24 Weeks and Endpoint (LOCF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24 Weeks, Endpoint (LOCF) up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Least squares mean values were controlled for Baseline + Baseline HbA1c Group + Baseline SU Group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hemoglobin A1C Less Than 7.0% and Hemoglobin A1C Less Than or Equal to 6.5%
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 12, 18, 24 and Endpoint (LOCF) up to 24 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: 7-Point Self-Monitored Blood Glucose (SMBG) Profiles at Baseline and Endpoint (LOCF)
secondary_outcome.description: SMBG at morning pre-meal, morning post-prandial, midday pre-meal, midday post-prandial, evening pre-meal, evening postprandial, 0300 hours. Post-prandial glucose is measured 2 hours after the start of the meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Glycemic Variability at Baseline and Endpoint (LOCF)
secondary_outcome.description: Glycemic variability was defined as the standard deviation (SD) of a participant's intra-day 7-point, self-monitored, blood glucose. Mean SD was calculated based on the SD for each participant in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Self-reported Hypoglycemic Episodes (All, Non-Nocturnal, Nocturnal, and Severe)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Endpoint (LOCF) up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Overall:any time after randomization.Episode:any time patient experienced sign/symptom associated with hypoglycemia, or had blood glucose level ≤70 mg/dL. Non-nocturnal:any episode that occurred between waking and bedtime. Nocturnal:any episode that occurred between bedtime and waking.Severe:episode with symptoms consistent with neuroglycopenia in which patient requires assistance,and is associated with:blood glucose value <50 mg/dL or prompt recovery after oral carbohydrate, glucagon, or intravenous glucose.Incidence(%)=(Number of patients experiencing episodes/number of patients in arm)*100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of All, Non-Nocturnal, and Nocturnal Self-Reported Hypoglycemic Episodes (Adjusted for One Year)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Endpoint (LOCF) up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of self-reported hypoglycemic episodes, all, non-nocturnal, and nocturnal, at Endpoint (LOCF) and overall. Rate is reported as episodes/participant/365 days. Episode = any time participant feels that he/she is experiencing a sign or symptom that is associated with hypoglycemia or has a blood glucose level of ≤70 mg/dL, even if it was not associated with signs, symptoms, or treatment. Overall=any time during the post-randomization visits within the study period. Nocturnal=Any episode that occurs between bedtime and waking. Non-Nocturnal=Any episode that occurs between waking and bedtime.

secondary_outcome.measure: Actual Body Weight at Baseline and Endpoint (LOCF)
Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Endpoint (LOCF)
Total Daily Insulin Dose at Endpoint (LOCF)

intervention.description: Administered subcutaneously once a day at bedtime
Administered subcutaneously once a day at bedtime

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have type 2 diabetes
- Must be at least 18 years of age and less than 75 years of age
- Must be taking exenatide 10 micrograms twice a day (BID) for at least 3 months
- Must be taking one of the following oral diabetes medication regimens for at least 3 months: (1) metformin (2) metformin + sulfonylurea (3) metformin + thiazolidinedione (TZD). Doses must be at or above the following: Metformin--1500 mg/day, Sulfonylurea--1/2 the maximum daily dose according to the product label, TZD--30 mg/day pioglitazone
- Must have a hemoglobin A1C greater than or equal to 7.0% and less than or equal to 10.0%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Must not have used insulin on a regular basis during the past 2 years
- Must not have taken any glucose-lowering medications not included in the inclusion criteria in the past 3 months
- Must not have had more than one episode of severe hypoglycemia in the past 6 months
- Must not have clinically significant hematologic, oncologic, renal, cardiac, hepatic, or gastrointestinal disease
- Must not be pregnant or intend to get pregnant during the course of the study

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Intention to Treat (ITT) Population consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had at least one post-baseline measurement.

group.description: Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension (ILPS) administered subcutaneously once a day at bedtime for 24 weeks

outcome.title: Incidence of Self-reported Hypoglycemic Episodes (All, Non-Nocturnal, Nocturnal, and Severe)
outcome.description: Overall:any time after randomization.Episode:any time patient experienced sign/symptom associated with hypoglycemia, or had blood glucose level ≤70 mg/dL. Non-nocturnal:any episode that occurred between waking and bedtime. Nocturnal:any episode that occurred between bedtime and waking.Severe:episode with symptoms consistent with neuroglycopenia in which patient requires assistance,and is associated with:blood glucose value <50 mg/dL or prompt recovery after oral carbohydrate, glucagon, or intravenous glucose.Incidence(%)=(Number of patients experiencing episodes/number of patients in arm)*100.

outcome.population: All randomized participants with at least one post-baseline measurement. Intention to Treat (ITT) population.

measure.description: Overall:any time after randomization.Episode:any time patient experienced sign/symptom associated with hypoglycemia, or had blood glucose level ≤70 mg/dL. Non-nocturnal:any episode that occurred between waking and bedtime. Nocturnal:any episode that occurred between bedtime and waking.Severe:episode with symptoms consistent with neuroglycopenia in which patient requires assistance,and is associated with:blood glucose value <50 mg/dL or prompt recovery after oral carbohydrate, glucagon, or intravenous glucose.Incidence(%)=(Number of patients experiencing episodes/number of patients in arm)*100.
measure.population: All randomized participants with at least one post-baseline measurement. Intention to Treat (ITT) population.

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for all reported hypoglycemic events at endpoint.
p-value is for all reported hypoglycemic events overall.
p-value is for non-nocturnal hypoglycemic events at endpoint.
p-value is for non-nocturnal hypoglycemic events overall.
p-value is for nocturnal hypoglycemic events at endpoint.
p-value is for nocturnal hypoglycemic events overall.
p-value is for severe hypoglycemic events overall.

outcome.title: Rate of All, Non-Nocturnal, and Nocturnal Self-Reported Hypoglycemic Episodes (Adjusted for One Year)
outcome.description: Rate of self-reported hypoglycemic episodes, all, non-nocturnal, and nocturnal, at Endpoint (LOCF) and overall. Rate is reported as episodes/participant/365 days. Episode = any time participant feels that he/she is experiencing a sign or symptom that is associated with hypoglycemia or has a blood glucose level of ≤70 mg/dL, even if it was not associated with signs, symptoms, or treatment. Overall=any time during the post-randomization visits within the study period. Nocturnal=Any episode that occurs between bedtime and waking. Non-Nocturnal=Any episode that occurs between waking and bedtime.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Endpoint (LOCF) up to 24 weeks
outcome.population: All randomized participants with at least one post-baseline measurement. Intention to Treat (ITT) population.

group.title: ILPS
group.description: Insulin Lispro Protamine Suspension (ILPS) administered subcutaneously once a day at bedtime for 24 weeks

group.title: Glargine
group.description: Insulin Glargine administered subcutaneously once a day at bedtime for 24 weeks

measure.title: Rate of All, Non-Nocturnal, and Nocturnal Self-Reported Hypoglycemic Episodes (Adjusted for One Year)
measure.description: Rate of self-reported hypoglycemic episodes, all, non-nocturnal, and nocturnal, at Endpoint (LOCF) and overall. Rate is reported as episodes/participant/365 days. Episode = any time participant feels that he/she is experiencing a sign or symptom that is associated with hypoglycemia or has a blood glucose level of ≤70 mg/dL, even if it was not associated with signs, symptoms, or treatment. Overall=any time during the post-randomization visits within the study period. Nocturnal=Any episode that occurs between bedtime and waking. Non-Nocturnal=Any episode that occurs between waking and bedtime.
measure.population: All randomized participants with at least one post-baseline measurement. Intention to Treat (ITT) population.

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for All reported episodes rate - Endpoint.
analysis.method_desc: Total hypoglycemia count=Treatment+Baseline HbA1c Group+Baseline SU Group with log of patient's total number of days of exposure as an offset variable

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for All reported episodes rate - Overall.
analysis.method_desc: Total hypoglycemia count=Treatment+Baseline HbA1c Group+Baseline SU Group with log of patient's total number of days of exposure as an offset variable

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for Non-Nocturnal reported episodes rate - Endpoint.
analysis.method_desc: Total hypoglycemia count=Treatment+Baseline HbA1c Group+Baseline SU Group with log of patient's total number of days of exposure as an offset variable

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for Non-Nocturnal reported episodes rate - Overall.
analysis.method_desc: Total hypoglycemia count=Treatment+Baseline HbA1c Group+Baseline SU Group with log of patient's total number of days of exposure as an offset variable

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for Nocturnal reported episodes rate - Endpoint.
analysis.method_desc: Total hypoglycemia count=Treatment+Baseline HbA1c Group+Baseline SU Group with log of patient's total number of days of exposure as an offset variable

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for Nocturnal reported episodes rate - Overall.
analysis.method_desc: Total hypoglycemia count=Treatment+Baseline HbA1c Group+Baseline SU Group with log of patient's total number of days of exposure as an offset variable

measure.title: Actual Body Weight at Baseline and Endpoint (LOCF)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
